snippet: As Europe's economies and bloated companies streamline, the Continent has become the latest playground for American leveraged-buyout specialists.    The cutthroat tactics of the 1980's, with vulture investors searching the landscape for takeover p...
lead_paragraph: As Europe's economies and bloated companies streamline, the Continent has become the latest playground for American leveraged-buyout specialists. The cutthroat tactics of the 1980's, with vulture investors searching the landscape for takeover prey, have fallen somewhat out of fashion in the United States. This phenomenon, it turns out, did not die, but migrated across the Atlantic.
abstract: California Medical Association, which claims 34,000 physician members, files civil lawsuit under Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act (RICO) against Blue Cross of California, unit of WellPoint Health Networks, HealthNet unit of Foundation Health Systems, and PacifiCare Health Systems, accusing three companies of violating laws by coercing doctors and interfering with physician-patient relationships for financial reasons; doctors say they turned to courts in frustration after talks with managed care plans failed to produce results doctors wanted, including higher payments for their services and ability to make medical decisions with less managed care oversight; suit is first broad-based legal assault on managed care by state medical association, according to medical officials in several states (M)

headline.main: When Bubbles Are Corporate Ferment; House of Taittinger, A French Demi-Icon, Is Raider's Quarry
